bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Note from Frances B. Sal[k] to Philip Showalter Hench, March 9, 1948

div1.p: Sal[k] thanks Hench for the copy of the address he delivered at the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Note from Frances B. Sal[k] to Philip Showalter Hench, March 9, 1948
div1.p:
THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR THE
COPY OF YOUR ADDRESS AT THEX UNIVERSITY
OF VIRGINIA. WHAT AN ADVENTURE! AND
WHAT PERSISTENCE YOU HAVE!

I SHALL SHARE MY COPY WITH MRS.
GAWNE WHOM I HOPE TO SEE SOON AS SHE IS
BACK FROM SOME YEARSweeks CRUISE AND A STAY IN
THE VIRGIN ISLANDS.

HARD AS IT IS TO BELIEVE IT, BUT
SPRING WILL COME, IT ALWAYS HAS, AND WE
HOPE IT WILL BRING YOU AND MRS HENCH TO
THIS PART OF THE COUNTRY.
